IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AS HOUSTON'S PREMIER LITERARY ARTS NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, INPRINT ANNUALLY SERVES MORE THAN 12,000 READERS AND WRITERS OF FICTION, POETRY, AND CREATIVE NONFICTION. INPRINT PROGRAMS INCLUDE: LITERARY PERFORMANCE PROGRAMS, WRITING WORKSHOPS AND SUPPORT FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF LITERARY WRITERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF INPRINT IS TO INSPIRE READERS AND WRITERS IN HOUSTON THROUGH LITERARY AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES WHICH STRIVE TO MAKE READING AND WRITING A VITAL ASPECT OF COMMUNITY LIFE IN HOUSTON.
IRS990.Desc: INPRINT'S LITERARY PERFORMANCE PROGRAM INCLUDES TWO READING SERIES, INPRINT MARGARETT ROOT BROWN READING SERIES (IBRS) FOR ADULTS AND THE INPRINT COOL BRAINS! SERIES FOR CHILDREN, AND RELATED COMMUNITY PROGRAMS -- ALL AT LITTLE OR NO COST TO THE PUBLIC. EVENTS INCLUDE AUTHOR READINGS, INTERVIEWS, AND BOOK SIGNINGS WHERE AUDIENCE MEMBERS CAN MEET AUTHORS. IBRS HAS FEATURED MORE THAN 370 WRITERS FROM 35 COUNTRIES, INCLUDING WINNERS OF 9 NOBEL PRIZES, 62 PULITZER PRIZES, AND 56 NATIONAL BOOK AWARDS; COOL BRAINS! HAS PRESENTED MORE THAN 30 RENOWNED MIDDLE-GRADE AUTHORS, INCLUDING WINNERS OF THE NEWBERY MEDAL, NATIONAL BOOK AWARD, AND CALDECOTT MEDAL. A TOTAL AUDIENCE OF 7,822 WAS DIRECTLY SERVED BY THESE PROGRAMS IN 2017-2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: WRITING WORKSHOPS AND OTHER COMMUNITY PROGRAMS: THE PURPOSE OF THESE VARIOUS WRITING WORKSHOPS IS TO PROVIDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, SENIOR CITIZENS, K-12 EDUCATORS, HOSPITAL EMPLOYEES, ADULTS WITH DEMENTIA, VETERANS, THE INCARCERATED, AND OTHERS WITH INSTRUCTION IN CREATIVE WRITING THAT ENABLES THEM, DEPENDING ON THE GROUP SERVED, TO STRENGTHEN THEIR WRITING SKILLS, PREPARE WORK FOR PUBLICATION, CREATE MEMOIRS THAT CAN BE SHARED WITH FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES, ENGAGE IN PERSONALLY REWARDING ACTIVITIES, AND IMPROVE COGNITIVE ABILITIES. INPRINT POETRY BUSKERS BRING THE JOY OF POETRY TO FESTIVALS AND PUBLIC EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER HOUSTON AREA. A TOTAL AUDIENCE OF 3,681 WAS DIRECTLY SERVED BY THESE PROGRAMS IN 2017-2018.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SUPPORT FOR THE NEXT GENERATION OF LITERARY WRITERS: SINCE 1983, INPRINT HAS PROVIDED FELLOWSHIPS, JURIED PRIZES, AND PAID WRITING-RELATED EMPLOYMENT TO MORE THAN 500 GRADUATE STUDENTS AND LOCAL AUTHORS, TOTALING MORE THAN $4 MILLION IN DIRECT SUPPORT OF WRITERS. INPRINT'S SUPPORT OF GRADUATE STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON CREATIVE WRITING PROGRAM AND MORE RECENTLY OF UNDERGRADUATES AT RICE UNIVERSITY, ALONG WITH OUTREACH PROGRAMS AT OTHER UNIVERSITIES AND SCHOOLS, ENHANCES HOUSTON AND HELPS TO ENSURE -- LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY -- THE FUTURE OF THE WRITTEN WORD. INPRINT STAFF MEETS REGULARLY WITH ADMINISTRATORS AND FACULTY AT UH, RICE, AND OTHER SCHOOLS, TO ASSESS AND MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THIS SUPPORT. A TOTAL AUDIENCE OF 142 WAS DIRECTLY SERVED BY THESE PROGRAMS IN 2017-2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FELLOWSHIP ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF SEVERAL INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR FELLOWSHIPS.

INCOME TAXES ARE NOT PROVIDED FOR IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS SINCE THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND SIMILAR STATE PROVISIONS. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT CLASSIFIED AS A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT ENGAGE IN ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES AND, THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS MADE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD ("FASB") ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION ("ASC") TOPIC NO. 740, ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES, PRESCRIBES ACCOUNTING FOR AND DISCLOSURE OF UNCERTAINTY IN TAX POSITIONS. THIS INTERPRETATION DEFINES THE CRITERIA THAT MUST BE MET FOR THE BENEFITS OF A TAX POSITION TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE MEASUREMENT OF TAX BENEFITS RECOGNIZED. FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT RECORD ANY LIABILITIES FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS OR INCOME TAXES. THE ORGANIZATION BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
DONATED PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FROM FINANCIAL ADVISORY GROUP 28,000.
DONATED PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FROM FINANCIAL ADVISORY GROUP 28,000.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON - DEPARTMENT OF ENGLISH

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: GULF COAST: A JOURNAL OF LITERATURE AND FINE ARTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INPRINT KEEPS WRITTEN RECORDS OF ALL FELLOWSHIPS GRANTED TO GRADUATE STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON CREATIVE WRITING PROGRAM (UH CWP). INPRINT STRIVES TO PROVIDE FELLOWSHIPS TO ALL INCOMING STUDENTS IN THE PROGRAM. WHEN FUNDING IS NOT AVAILABLE TO GRANT FELLOWSHIPS TO ALL STUDENTS, THE FACULTY AT THE UH CWP CHOOSES WHICH STUDENTS RECEIVE FELLOWSHIPS FROM INPRINT. THESE FELLOWSHIPS ARE AWARDED IN MULTIPLE PARTS, THE FIRST UPON MATRICULATION AND THE REMAINDER THROUGH A SCHEDULE DETERMINED BY THE UH CWP ADMINISTRATION. THE UH CWP ADMINISTRATION NOTIFIES INPRINT WHICH STUDENTS HAVE QUALIFIED FOR THEIR FINAL PAYMENTS. THESE FELLOWSHIPS ARE GRANTED WITHOUT ANY EXPECTATIONS OTHER THAN THAT THE STUDENT BE ENROLLED IN THE UH CWP GRADUATE PROGRAM IN CREATIVE WRITING. IN ADDITION TO THESE FELLOWSHIPS, INPRINT GIVES FELLOWSHIP ASSISTANCE TO ALL INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS IN THE PROGRAM AND ANY STUDENT WITHOUT A TEACHING ASSISTANCESHIP WHO NEEDS A SMALL FELLOWSHIP TO QUALIFY FOR IN-STATE TUITION. THE UH CWP ADMINISTRATION PROVIDES THE NAMES OF STUDENTS REQUIRING THIS ASSISTANCE. INPRINT ALSO GRANTS MERIT-BASED PRIZES TO CONTINUING STUDENTS. THESE COMPETITIVE GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS CHOSEN BY OUTSIDE JUDGES, WHO ARE SELECTED BY THE FACULTY MEMBERS OF THE UH CWP. NO REQUIREMENTS ARE ATTACHED TO THESE PRIZES, THOUGH THE EXPECTATION IS THAT THEY WILL ENABLE STUDENTS TO SPEND MORE TIME WRITING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 REVIEW POLICY A COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OFFICERS PRIOR TO THE FILING DATE. IN ADDITION, THE STAFF WILL REVIEW THE 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EVERY STAFF MEMBER AND BOARD MEMBER IS ASKED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATING ANY CONFLICTS OR FINANCIAL ASSOCIATIONS WITH INPRINT UNDERWRITERS OR SERVICE PROVIDERS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS NOTIFIED OF ANY ASSOCIATIONS REVEALED IN THE PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION POLICY AFTER RESEARCHING SALARIES AT COMPARABLE NON-PROFIT ART ORGANIZATIONS, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY IS SET BY THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE, WHICH IS APPROVED BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS. FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE APPROVES THE SALARIES AFTER THEY ARE SET BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WHO HAS INVESTIGATED COMPARABLES. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVES THE SALARIES, AS A PACKAGE, WHEN PASSING THE BUDGET EACH SPRING. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECEIVE NO MONETARY COMPENSATION FOR THEIR BOARD SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTATION FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.

THE ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS FOR ASSUMING RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT, REVIEW, OR COMPILATION OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR HAVE NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SECTION 1.263(A)-1(F) DE MINIMIS SAFE HARBOR ELECTION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INPRINT, INC 1520 WEST MAIN HOUSTON, TX 77006 EMPLOYER IDENTIFICATION NUMBER: 76-0127748 FOR THE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2018 INPRINT, INC IS MAKING THE DE MINIMIS SAFE HARBOR ELECTION UNDER REG. SEC. 1.263(A)-1(F).
